alert.note: Alert for Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 10:27PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Scotts Bluff and southern Sioux Counties through 1000 PM MDT... At 927 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Morrill, or 11 miles southeast of Torrington, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Morrill around 935 PM MDT. Mitchell around 950 PM MDT. Lake Alice around 1000 PM MDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Henry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
